text.text_translated: The first project is called DART. DART stands for the Double Asteroid Redirection Test. There are plans to test DART on the moon of an asteroid called Didymos. This moon is called 'Didymoon'. It is 150 metres wide and travels in an **orbit** around its 800-metre mother asteroid. An **orbit** is the path an object takes. The plan is to see if the impact of DART can push the moon from its path. This change should be big enough for telescopes on Earth to notice.
